I've been saying this for years and I'll repeat it until I'm blue in the face: Riot needs to shut off their playerbase and only take feedback from the highest level (Masters+, with Diamond being an iffy). Then we can start to make some progress.

People don't know what they want, they just always want something and will never be happy. As much as I pick on Riot, they've done a pretty bang-up job with the trash they have to deal with.
That's a bad idea, the viewpoint is too small and too skewed.

I agree: League can't shut out community ideas and thoughts since Riot balances around pub play and pro play. Most of the suggestions on the board/Reddit are bad, but some of what the community has suggested before has been beneficial and even implemented by Riot.

^ That's what matters.
It doesn't matter if higher elo players know best when there's only a handful of them compared to everyone else.

You do realise Bronze-Silver MAKE this entire game. Go look up the distribution of players in each division and come back and try to say how it should be balanced around Masters (lol).

Don't get me wrong though, you are right. Most of the stuff the community and low elo players suggest/cry about is stupid. 
However, balancing a game around the elite players is completely stupid considering the game is mainly played by them low elo players. They HAVE to be catered for.

They can't balance it around high elo alone as it will destroy low elo. It's only logical.
Good luck keeping the game running with no players after doing that.
no don't worry i know what i want, rito as the worst devs i ever seen period.
So then you'd be fucked up the ass by Yi and Garen suddenly hitting 80%+ win rates in low ELO because they were balanced based off of pro play.

That's a really bad idea.
Riot should take criticism and our feedback into consideration but we should also have to understand what what we want Riot to do, may never exactly happen like we want it to happen. It's their game and we have a chance to influence the decision over the direction the game takes but to firmly believe that we can demand every change we want to be implemented is not what giving feedback means.
It's like saying only a certain group in society should be able to vote... This is the dumbest shit I've read, sry.

A story from my Dad's workplace, they had just replaced the Elevators with Smart Elevators, which are meant to save electricity by memorizing patterns and make routes to pick up X amount of people the fastest. Slightly complicated, but whatever, it's simple to use though. You press a 
floor button, a number flashes on the screen, and you head to the elevator that the number matches to get to your floor.

Despite having signs, actual attendants helping, and it being fairly simple, people hated it and wanted it stopped ~~reverted~~. Doesn't matter if it was saving 66%(ish) electricity than the old ones, they just didn't want to learn this new system because they disliked it. They acted like they were owed, or deserved, the right to bring back the old ones, and these are adults. 

Point being, sometimes a rough transition can still have beneficial results, but people are too stubborn in their ways to see them.
